nodes.id: Do you know your CIBIL score?
nodes.options: Yes | No

nodes.id: Which is more stressful to you?
nodes.options: Investing in real estate | Investing in stocks, mutual funds, SIP, etc

nodes.id: If buying a flat for investment, which would you prefer?
nodes.topic: Real Estate Investment in metro tier-2/3
nodes.options: Flat in metro city, tier 1 city | Flat in tier 2, 3 city

nodes.id: How much return per annum do you expect from your SIP/mutual fund investment?
nodes.options: 11 to 15% | 16 to 20% | More than 21% | Less than 10%

nodes.id: Which bank do you mainly use?
nodes.options: Private bank | Govt bank

nodes.id: Are you paying any of the following right now?
nodes.options: Home loan EMI | Rent | Home loan EMI + rent

nodes.id: Has your loan application (home, car, education, etc) ever been denied?
nodes.options: No | Yes

nodes.id: Which is better?
nodes.options: FD from big bank | FD from small bank/cooperative bank

nodes.id: Let's say your overall investment is earning 12% per annum. Which of the two options will you choose?
nodes.options: 2% lower return but you are never stressed | 2% higher return but you are very stressed

nodes.id: Which investment do you consider to be safer?
nodes.topic: Safe Investment Gold vs Real estate
nodes.options: Gold | Real estate

nodes.id: Do you know the difference between Sensex and Nifty?
nodes.options: Yes | No

nodes.id: Where would you ask your friend (who is not interested in finance) to invest?
nodes.options: Mutual funds | Gold | FD | Shares | Real estate | F&O

nodes.id: Which is the most expensive thing you have ever bought?
nodes.options: House | Education | Car/Bike | Electronic Devices | Others

nodes.id: Which way do you prefer to pay?
nodes.options: UPI | Card | Cash

nodes.id: Do you pay for a 'premium plan' for any app (like YouTube, Spotify, etc)?
nodes.options: No | Yes

nodes.id: You buy large appliances using
nodes.options: 100% down payment | EMI

nodes.id: Which do you prefer?
nodes.options: Invest more in equity (shares, MF) and less in safer investments (FD, bonds, etc) | Invest more in safer investments (FD, bonds, etc) and less in equity (shares, MF)

nodes.id: What is your current portfolio return?
nodes.options: More than 15% | Less than 10% | 10 to 15%

nodes.id: Which kind of mutual fund do you have most money invested in?
nodes.options: Mid-cap + small cap | Large-cap / index funds | Others | ELSS

nodes.id: From the option below, which investment portfolio is better?
nodes.options: Equity (shares or MF) + Gold | Equity (shares or MF) + FD | FD + Gold

nodes.id: Which country's stock markets do you think give higher returns?
nodes.options: India | USA | China | UK

nodes.id: Which investment asset do you dislike the most?
nodes.options: FD | Real estate | Stocks (including mutual funds) | Others | Gold

nodes.id: Which is better?
nodes.options: Market falls 1% on Mon; climbs 1% on Tue | It's the same | Market falls 10% on Mon; climbs 10% on Tue

nodes.id: Which is better for loans?
nodes.topic: Loan by private vs Govt bank
nodes.options: Govt bank | Private bank | It's the same

nodes.id: Who makes investment decisions?
nodes.options: I make my investment decisions | I make my investment decisions with help from others (family, friends) | A family/friend decides for me

nodes.id: Which would you prefer to invest in?
nodes.options: FD in a big bank (lower FD interest rates) | FD in a small bank (higher FD interest rates)

nodes.id: Have you travelled outside India?
nodes.options: Yes | No

nodes.id: Which transport option have you used most to travel outside your home location in 2024?
nodes.options: Train | Personal vehicle | Bus | Plane | Others

nodes.id: Which of these is written on your debit/credit card?
nodes.options: 2 or more of the above | Visa | Rupay | Mastercard | Amex

nodes.id: Have you travelled outside India?
nodes.options: Never | More than 2 times | Less than 2 times

nodes.id: When was the last time you visited a bank branch?
nodes.options: More than 6 months ago | In last 7 days | In last 1 month | In last 6 months

nodes.id: Who files your income tax?
nodes.options: I do it myself | My CA does it for me | I don’t file taxes/not eligible

nodes.id: Which will make you rich faster?
nodes.topic: Want to get rich fast? Job vs Business
nodes.options: Your business | Investing in stocks/mutual funds | Your job | Others

nodes.options: Prepaid SIM connection | Postpaid SIM connection

nodes.options: Yes | No

nodes.options: Airtel | Jio | BSNL | Vodafone-Idea (Vi)

nodes.options: Both are important | Nifty | Sensex | Both are not important

nodes.id: How many smartphones do you have?
nodes.topic: How many phone do you have?
nodes.options: One | Two | Zero | Three or more

nodes.id: Are you happy with your investments’ returns?
nodes.options: Yes | No | Neutral | Not investing yet

nodes.id: Do you have an active SIP right now?
nodes.options: Yes | No

nodes.id: If you had home loan EMIs to pay, what would you do?
nodes.options: Continue both EMIs and investing at the same time | Stop investing; put all extra money in pre-paying loans

nodes.id: Is using a credit card better (instead of debit card and UPI)?
nodes.options: Yes | No

nodes.id: Which do you prefer to use?
nodes.options: Personal vehicle | Public transport | Cab/taxi

nodes.options: Govt bank | Private bank | Co-op bank

nodes.id: Which would you trust more? Assume all other things are equal.
nodes.options: 100-year-old bank | Both are the same | 20-year-old bank

nodes.topic: Train/plane booking on laptop or mobile
nodes.options: Smartphone | Laptop | Offline ticket counter | Travel agent

nodes.id: Which do you prefer?

nodes.options: All investment decisions made by you | Mix of both | All investment decisions made by someone else (family, advisor, etc)

nodes.id: Which is more important according to you?
nodes.options: Nifty 50 | Both are the same | Sensex 30

nodes.options: Worse than expected | As expected | Better than expected

nodes.options: Yes, will invest more | No, will keep the same | No, will invest less

nodes.id: Are you increasing your monthly investment/SIP in the new year?
nodes.options: Yes | No

nodes.options: Stocks | Real estate

nodes.options: 1 to 3 | 4 to 6 | 0 | More than 10 | 7 to 10

nodes.options: Yes | No

nodes.options: Yes | No

nodes.options: Paying using UPI (PhonePe, G-Pay, etc.) | Paying using cash

nodes.options: Yes, I have to travel often | No, one location only

nodes.options: Yes, I have a CA | No, I do it myself | No, I don’t pay tax yet

nodes.id: Do you use a computer/laptop?
nodes.options: No, my smartphone is enough | Yes

nodes.options: Jio | Airtel | Vodafone-Idea (Vi) | BSNL/MTNL

nodes.options: Govt bank | Private Indian bank | Doesn’t matter | Private international bank

nodes.options: Tier 1 city | Rural area | Small town | Tier 2 city | Tier 3/4 city

nodes.options: G-Pay | PhonePe | PayTM | Others

nodes.options: Android (Samsung, Xiaomi, Vivo) | iOS (iPhone)

nodes.id: Have you ever bought electronics (AC, mobiles, TV, etc) on EMI?
nodes.options: No | Yes

nodes.options: Yes | No

nodes.options: Less than 1 month’s income | 1 month’s income | 2-4 months’ income | 5 or more than 5 months’ income

nodes.options: Equity (direct stocks or mutual funds) | Real estate

nodes.options: Debit card | Credit card

nodes.options: Tier 2/3 city | Small town | Tier 1 city | Rural area

nodes.options: Tier 1 city | Tier 2/3 city | Small town | Rural area

nodes.options: Yes | No

nodes.options: Yes | No

nodes.options: 2020 and after | 2015 to 2019 | 2010 to 2014 | In or before 2009

nodes.options: They are too high | They are fair | They are too low

nodes.options: Google Pay | PhonePe | Paytm | Others

nodes.options: Yes | No

nodes.options: Less than Rs 1 lakh | Don't own vehicle/Rs 0 | More than Rs 8 lakh | Rs 4 lakh to Rs 8 lakh | Rs 2 lakh to Rs 4 lakh

nodes.options: Me | My neighbour | We're more or less the same

nodes.options: Large house in rural area | Small house in urban area
